sen.j: 円珍（えんちん、弘仁5年（814年）- 寛平3年10月29日 (旧暦)（891年12月4日））は、平安時代の天台宗の僧。
sen.e: Enchin (814 to December 4, 891) was a monk of Tendai Sect in the Heian period.
Enchin (814 to December 4, 891) was a monk of Tendai Sect in the Heian period.
Enchin (814 to December 4, 891) was a monk of Tendai Sect in the Heian period.

sen.j: 天台寺門宗の宗祖。
sen.e: Sect founder of Tendai Jimonshu.
He was the sect founder of Tendai Jimonshu.
He was the sect founder of Tendai Jimonshu.

sen.j: 諡号（しごう）は智証大師（ちしょうだいし）。
sen.e: His posthumous title was Chisho Daishi.
sen.cmt: 智証大師はChisho Daishiとしました。
sen.e: His posthumous title was Chisho Daishi.
His posthumous title was Chisho Daishi.

sen.j: 入唐八家（最澄・空海・常暁・円行・円仁・恵運・円珍・宗叡）の一人。
sen.e: One of the eight priests who went to China (Saicho, Kukai, Jogyo, Engyo, Ennin, Eun, Enchin, and Shuei)
He was one of the eight priests who went to China (Saicho, Kukai, Jogyo, Engyo, Ennin, Eun, Enchin, and Shuei).
sen.cmt: 主語、動詞、ピリオド追加
sen.e: He was one of the eight priests who went to China (Saicho, Kukai, Jogyo, Engyo, Ennin, Eun, Enchin, and Shuei).

sen.j: 讃岐国（香川県）金倉郷に弘仁5年（814年）に誕生。
sen.e: Born in Kanakura-go of Sanuki Province (Kagawa Prefecture) in 814.
He was born in Kanakura-go of Sanuki Province (Kagawa Prefecture) in 814.
He was born in Kanakura-go of Sanuki Province (Kagawa Prefecture) in 814.

sen.j: 多度郡弘田郷の豪族・佐伯一門のひとり。
sen.e: A member of a local ruling family, Saeki family of Hirota-go, Tadono-gori
He was a member of a local ruling family, Saeki family of Hirota-go, Tadono-gori
He was a member of a local ruling family, Saeki family of Hirota-go, Tadono-gori

sen.j: 空海（弘法大師）の姪の子息にあたる。
sen.e: A child of a niece of Kukai (Kobo Daishi).
He was a child of a niece of Kukai (Kobo Daishi).
He was a child of a niece of Kukai (Kobo Daishi).

sen.j: 生誕地は善通寺から4kmほどのところ。
sen.e: The birth place is about 4 km away from Zentsu-ji Temple.
His birth place is about 4 km away from Zentsu-ji Temple.
His birth place is about 4 km away from Zentsu-ji Temple.

sen.j: 幼少から経典になじみ、15歳（数え年、以下同）で比叡山に登り義真に師事。
sen.e: He studied Buddhist scriptures from the cradle, went to Hiei-zan Mountain at the age of 15 (age by the traditional Japanese system; the same applies below), studied under Gishin, tonsured at the age of 20, was confined in the mountain for 12 years and became gakuto (head student).
He studied Buddhist scriptures from the cradle, and went to Mt.Hiei at the age of 15 (age by the traditional Japanese system; the same applies below) to studied under Gishin.
sen.cmt: 接続詞追加Hiei-zan Mountain をMt.Hieiに変更一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He studied Buddhist scripture from an early age, and went to Mt. Hiei at the age of 15 (all ages given in this article are according to the traditional Japanese system) to study under Gishin.
sen.cmt: from the cradle→from an early ageto studied→to study

sen.j: 20歳で落髪し12年間山にこもり学頭となる。
sen.e: He took the tonsure at the age of 20, confined himself in the mountain for 12 years and became gakuto (head student).
sen.cmt: 文章の書き換え一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He took the tonsure at the age of 20, confined himself in the mountain for 12 years and became gakuto (head student).

sen.j: 仁寿3年（853年）に新羅商人の船で入唐、天安 (日本)2年（858年）に唐商人の船で帰国。
sen.e: He went to the Tang on a Silla merchant ship in 853 and returned to Japan on a Tang merchant ship in 858.
He went to Tang on a Silla merchant ship in 853 and returned to Japan on a Tang merchant ship in 858.
He went to Tang on a Silla merchant ship in 853 and returned to Japan on a Tang merchant ship in 858.

sen.j: 帰国後しばらく現四国八十八箇所第76番金倉寺に住み、寺の整備を行っていた模様。
sen.e: He lived in the 76th temple, Konzo-ji Temple, of Shikoku's eighty-eight sacred places for a while after returning to the country to maintain the temple.
He lived in Konzo-ji Temple, the 76th temple of Shikoku's eighty-eight sacred places for a while to maintain the temple after returning to the country.
He lived in Konzo-ji Temple, the 76th temple of Shikoku's eighty-eight sacred places for a while to maintain the temple after returning to the country.

sen.j: その後比叡山の山王院に住し、貞観10年（868年）延暦寺第5代座主となり、園城寺（三井寺）を賜り、伝法灌頂の道場とした。
sen.e: He lived in Sanno-in Temple on Mt. Hiei, became the 5th head priest of Enryaku-ji Temple in 868, received Onjo-ji Temple (Mii-dera Temple) for Dojo training hall for denpokanjo (consecration for the Transmission of the Dharma).

He lived in Sanno-in Temple on Mt. Hiei, then in 868, he became the fifth head priest of Enryaku-ji Temple, and received Onjo-ji Temple (Mii-dera Temple) for Dojo training hall for denpokanjo (consecration for the Transmission of the Dharma).
sen.cmt: 接続詞追加と年号の位置を変更。5thをスペルアウト
sen.e: He lived in Sanno-in Temple on Mt. Hiei, then in 868, he became the fifth head priest of Enryaku-ji Temple, and received Onjo-ji Temple (Mii-dera Temple) for Dojo training hall for denpokanjo (consecration for the Transmission of the Dharma).

sen.j: 後に叡山を山門派が占拠したため園城寺は寺門派の拠点となる。
sen.e: Since Mt. Hiei was occupied by the Sanmon school, Onjo-ji Temple became a base for the Sanmon school.
Since Mt. Hiei was occupied by the Sanmon school, Onjo-ji Temple became a base for the Sanmon school.
Since Mt. Hiei was occupied by the Sanmon school, Onjo-ji Temple became a base for the Sanmon school.

sen.j: 円珍が唐より持ち帰った一切経の2組は、園城寺と実相寺に収められた。
sen.e: The two copies of complete Buddhist scriptures that Enchin brought back to Japan were stored in Onjo-ji Temple and Jisso-ji Temple.
The two copies of complete Buddhist scriptures that Enchin brought back from Tang to Japan were stored in Onjo-ji Temple and Jisso-ji Temple.
The two copies of complete Buddhist scriptures that Enchin brought back from Tang to Japan were stored in Onjo-ji Temple and Jisso-ji Temple.

sen.j: 入寂は、寛平3年（891年）78歳。
sen.e: He died at the age of 78 in 891.
He died at the age of 78 in 891.
He died at the age of 78 in 891.

sen.j: 三井寺には、円珍が感得したとされる「黄不動」「新羅明神像」等の美術品の他、円珍の手による文書が他数残されており、日本美術史上も注目される。
sen.e: Arts, such as 'Kifudo painting' and 'Shinra Myojin zo', which inspired Enchin, and a lot of documents written by him remain in Mii-dera Temple, and they are regarded as important materials in the Japanese art history.

Arts, such as 'Kifudo painting' and 'Shinra Myojin zo', which inspired Enchin, and a lot of documents written by him remain in Mii-dera Temple, and they are regarded as important materials in the Japanese art history.

Arts, such as 'Kifudo painting' and 'Shinra Myojin zo', which inspired Enchin, and a lot of documents written by him remain in Mii-dera Temple, and they are regarded as important materials in the Japanese art history.

sen.j: 著作は90を数え、円珍の教えを知る著作の他、自身の書いた入唐旅行記など著名である。
sen.e: He wrote over 90 documents; the documents containing Enchin's teachings and a journal of his travel to the Tang are very famous.
He wrote over 90 documents and the documents containing Enchin's teachings and a journal of his travel to the Tang are very famous.
He wrote over 90 documents and the documents containing Enchin's teachings and a journal of his travel to the Tang are very famous.

sen.j: 『智証大師全集』全3巻がある。
sen.e: There are three volumes of "Chisho Daishi zenshu (The Complete Writings of Chisho Daishi)".
There are three volumes of "Chisho Daishi zenshu" (The Complete Writings of Chisho Daishi).
There are three volumes of "Chisho Daishi zenshu" (The Complete Writings of Chisho Daishi).

sen.j: 円珍は、園城寺では宗祖として尊崇され、同寺には国宝の彫像をはじめ、多くの円珍像が伝わる。
sen.e: Enchin was worshiped as the founder of a religious sect in Onjo-ji Temple and there are plenty of statues of Enchin, including a statue designated as a national treasure, in the same temple.
Enchin was worshiped as the founder of a religious sect in Onjo-ji Temple and the temple has plenty of statues of Enchin, including a statue designated as a national treasure.
sen.cmt: 「同寺」とありますが、in the same templeをthe temple has・・・と書き換えました。
sen.e: Enchin was worshiped as the founder of a religious sect in Onjo-ji Temple and the temple has plenty of statues of Enchin, including a statue designated as a national treasure.

sen.j: 同寺唐院大師堂には「中尊大師」「御骨大師」と称する2体の智証大師像があり、いずれも国宝に指定されている。
sen.e: In Toin Daishi Do of the temple, here are two statues of Chisho Daishi named as 'Chuson Daishi' (the Great teacher of the principal statue of in a group of Buddhist statues) and 'Okotsu Daishi (the statue of Great Teacher with its remains in it)' which are designated as national treasures.

In Toin Daishi Do of the temple, there are two statues of Chisho Daishi named as 'Chuson Daishi' (the Great teacher of the principal statue of in a group of Buddhist statues) and 'Okotsu Daishi' (the statue of Great Teacher with its remains in it) which are designated as national treasures.

In Toin Daishi Do of the temple, there are two statues of Chisho Daishi named as 'Chuson Daishi' (the Great teacher of the principal statue of in a group of Buddhist statues) and 'Okotsu Daishi' (the statue of Great Teacher with its remains in it) which are designated as national treasures.

sen.j: いずれの像も頭頂が尖り、頭部の輪郭が卵型を呈する独特の風貌に特徴がある。
sen.e: The statues have a characteristic appearance: the tops of the heads are pointed and the heads have an oval outline.
Both statues have characteristic appearances: the tops of the heads are pointed and the heads have an oval outline.
sen.cmt: 「いずれの」とあるので、Theではなく、Bothにしました
sen.e: Both statues have characteristic appearances: the tops of the heads are pointed and the heads have an oval outline.

sen.j: 書風は「枯枝のような」と評される独特のものである。
sen.e: His style of calligraphy is distinctive and described 'like a withered branch'.
His calligraphy was distinctive and was described as a 'withered branch-like' style.
His distinctive style of calligraphy produced Japanese characters that were said to resemble 'withered branches'.

sen.j: 真跡は20余点現存し、その代表的なものは次のとおりである。
sen.e: There are about 20 shinseki (original handwritings) of Enchin and typical ones are as follows.
There are about 20 existing shinseki (original handwritings) of Enchin and typical ones are as follows.
There are about 20 existing shinseki (original handwritings) of Enchin and typical ones are as follows.

sen.j: 円珍書状（寄遍照）（国宝）
sen.e: Enchin's letters (yorihenjo) (National treasure)
Enchin's letters (yorihenjo) (National treasure)
Enchin's letters (yorihenjo) (National treasure)

sen.j: 東京国立博物館所蔵の国宝「円珍関係文書」のうち。
sen.e: National treasure 'Documents associated with Enchin' in Tokyo National Museum
One of the national treasures 'Documents associated with Enchin' in Tokyo National Museum.
sen.cmt: 「のうち」をone of theとしましたピリオド追加
sen.e: One of the national treasures 'Documents associated with Enchin' in Tokyo National Museum.

sen.j: 古今和歌集の歌人である遍昭僧正への返信で、年はなく5月27日の日付があるのみであるが、晩年の手紙と推定される。
sen.e: Reply to Sojo Henjo, a poet in Kokin Wakashu (A Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry), dated May 27 (no year), which is estimated to be a letter in his later years.
sen.cmt: 遍昭僧正は、インターネットによると僧正遍昭と同じということなのでSojo Henjoとしました。
sen.e: It was a reply to Sojo Henjo, a poet in Kokin Wakashu (A Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry), and it was dated May 27 with the year unknown, but it is estimated to be a letter in his later years.
sen.cmt: 主語・動詞を加え、また「年はなく」の部分を書き換えました
sen.e: It was a reply to Sojo Henjo, a poet in Kokin Wakashu (A Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry), and it was dated May 27 with the year unknown, but it is estimated to be a letter in his later years.

sen.j: 一見稚拙のようだが、古渋な勁い書である。
sen.e: It seems to be childish, but it is tasteful and excellent handwriting.
It seems to be poor, but it is tasteful and excellent handwriting.
sen.cmt: childishだと子供っぽい、というイメージなので、poorに変更しました
sen.e: It seems to be poor, but it is tasteful and excellent handwriting.

sen.j: 請伝法公験奏状案（でんぽうくげんをこう そうじょうあん）（国宝）
sen.e: Denpoukugenoko sojoan (National treasure)
Denpoukugenoko sojoan (National treasure)
Denpoukugenoko sojoan (National treasure)

sen.j: 園城寺所蔵の国宝「智証大師関係文書典籍」のうち。
sen.e: National treasure 'Documents associated with Chisho Daishi' in Onjo-ji Temple
One of the national treasures 'Documents associated with Chisho Daishi' in Onjo-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 「のうち」をone of theとしましたピリオド追加
sen.e: One of the national treasures 'Documents associated with Chisho Daishi' in Onjo-ji Temple.

sen.j: 入唐からの帰国後、伝法のための公験（証明書）を請求するため、朝廷に提出した文書の案である。
sen.e: It is a draft of a document submitted to the imperial court to apply for certification for teachings of Buddhism after he came back to Japan from the Tang.
It was a draft of a document submitted to the imperial court to apply for certification for teachings of Buddhism after he came back to Japan from Tang.
sen.cmt: 時制の変更Tangの定冠詞を削除
sen.e: It was a draft of a document submitted to the imperial court to apply for certification for teachings of Buddhism after he came back to Japan from Tang.

sen.j: 貞観5年（863年）11月13日の日付がある。
sen.e: It is dated November 13, 863.
It was dated November 13, 863.
It was dated November 13, 863.

sen.j: 書風は行書風の特徴ある楷書。
sen.e: His style of handwriting is a characteristic kaisho (block script).
His style of handwriting was a characteristic cursive-styled kaisho (block script).
sen.cmt: 時制の変更「行書風の」cursive-styledを追加
sen.e: His style of handwriting was a characteristic cursive-styled kaisho (block script).
